name: Barry Moore
bio: Barry Moore is the U.S. Representative for Alabama’s 1st congressional district. He previously represented the 2nd district and served in the Alabama House. A veteran and small business owner, Moore is known for his conservative positions and membership in the House Freedom Caucus.
education: Auburn University (BS in Agricultural Science)
endorsements: House Freedom Fund, National Rifle Association, Alabama Farmers Federation
platform: Border security, fiscal responsibility, veterans’ support, and agricultural development.

platformFollowThrough.Border Security: Supported legislation to increase funding for border enforcement and oppose sanctuary policies.
platformFollowThrough.Fiscal Responsibility: Voted against omnibus spending bills and supported balanced budget amendments.
platformFollowThrough.Veterans’ Support: Advocated for expanded mental health services and faster claims processing for veterans.
platformFollowThrough.Agricultural Development: Introduced bills to reduce regulatory burdens on farmers and expand rural broadband.

proposals: Secure the border, cut wasteful spending, support veterans, and empower rural communities.

name: Shomari Figures
bio: Shomari Figures is the U.S. Representative for Alabama’s 2nd congressional district, elected in 2024. A former Department of Justice official and Birmingham native, Figures focuses on voting rights, criminal justice reform, and economic equity. He serves on the House Judiciary and Oversight Committees.
education: Morehouse College (BA), Stanford Law School (JD)
endorsements: Congressional Black Caucus PAC, End Citizens United, Alabama Democratic Conference
platform: Voting rights, criminal justice reform, economic equity, and healthcare access.

platformFollowThrough.Voting Rights: Introduced legislation to restore key provisions of the Voting Rights Act.
platformFollowThrough.Criminal Justice Reform: Advocated for sentencing reform and police accountability measures.
platformFollowThrough.Economic Equity: Supported small business grants and workforce development programs in underserved communities.
platformFollowThrough.Healthcare Access: Backed Medicaid expansion and rural health clinic funding.

proposals: Protect voting rights, reform the justice system, expand healthcare, and invest in underserved communities.

govtrackStats.Committee Positions: Member of Judiciary and Oversight Committees

name: Mike Rogers
bio: Mike Rogers is the U.S. Representative for Alabama’s 3rd congressional district, serving since 2003. A former state legislator and attorney, Rogers is known for his work on national security, agriculture, and veterans’ affairs. He chairs the House Armed Services Committee and is a senior member of the Homeland Security Committee.
education: Jacksonville State University (BA, MPA), Birmingham School of Law (JD)
endorsements: National Rifle Association, Alabama Farmers Federation, American Legion
platform: National defense, border security, veterans’ support, and rural development.

platformFollowThrough.National Defense: Championed increased defense spending and modernization of military infrastructure.
platformFollowThrough.Border Security: Supported legislation to fund border wall construction and enhance immigration enforcement.
platformFollowThrough.Veterans’ Support: Pushed for expanded VA services and mental health resources for veterans.
platformFollowThrough.Rural Development: Advocated for broadband expansion and agricultural subsidies.

proposals: Strengthen national defense, secure the border, support veterans, and invest in rural America.

govtrackStats.Committee Positions: Chair of Armed Services, Member of Homeland Security

name: Robert Aderholt
bio: Robert Aderholt is the U.S. Representative for Alabama’s 4th congressional district, serving since 1997. A former judge and legal advisor, Aderholt is known for his conservative positions on fiscal policy, religious freedom, and agriculture. He serves on the House Appropriations Committee and chairs the Subcommittee on Labor, Health and Human Services, Education, and Related Agencies.
education: University of Alabama (BA), Cumberland School of Law (JD)
endorsements: National Right to Life, Alabama Farmers Federation, Family Research Council
platform: Fiscal conservatism, religious liberty, agriculture, and rural healthcare.

platformFollowThrough.Fiscal Conservatism: Consistently voted against deficit-increasing legislation and supported budgetary restraint.
platformFollowThrough.Religious Liberty: Sponsored bills to protect religious expression in schools and public institutions.
platformFollowThrough.Agriculture: Advocated for farm subsidies and rural development programs.
platformFollowThrough.Rural Healthcare: Pushed for increased funding for rural hospitals and telemedicine expansion.

proposals: Cut government spending, defend religious freedom, support farmers, and improve rural healthcare access.

govtrackStats.Committee Positions: Chair of Appropriations Subcommittee on Labor, HHS, Education

name: Dale Strong
bio: Dale Strong is the U.S. Representative for Alabama’s 5th congressional district, elected in 2022. A former Madison County Commissioner and emergency services leader, Strong focuses on infrastructure, public safety, and defense. He serves on the House Armed Services and Transportation and Infrastructure Committees.
education: University of Alabama in Huntsville (BS in Business Administration)
endorsements: Alabama Farmers Federation, National Association of Police Organizations, Huntsville Chamber of Commerce

platformFollowThrough.Defense Support: Advocated for increased defense contracts and support for Redstone Arsenal.
platformFollowThrough.Emergency Preparedness: Introduced legislation to improve FEMA coordination and local response capabilities.
platformFollowThrough.Economic Growth: Supported tax incentives for small businesses and workforce development programs.

proposals: Modernize infrastructure, strengthen national defense, improve emergency response, and grow local economies.

name: Gary Palmer
bio: Gary Palmer is the U.S. Representative for Alabama’s 6th congressional district, serving since 2015. A former think tank president and policy analyst, Palmer is known for his conservative views on energy, healthcare, and government reform. He serves on the House Oversight and Energy and Commerce Committees.
education: University of Alabama (BS in Operations Management)
endorsements: Club for Growth, Heritage Action, Alabama Policy Institute
platform: Energy independence, healthcare reform, government accountability, and fiscal discipline.

platformFollowThrough.Healthcare Reform: Advocated for repeal of the Affordable Care Act and market-based healthcare solutions.
platformFollowThrough.Government Accountability: Introduced bills to increase transparency and reduce bureaucratic overreach.
platformFollowThrough.Fiscal Discipline: Voted consistently for balanced budgets and spending caps.

proposals: Unleash domestic energy, reform healthcare, shrink government, and restore fiscal responsibility.

name: Terri Sewell
bio: Terri Sewell is the U.S. Representative for Alabama’s 7th congressional district, serving since 2011. A Harvard-trained attorney and Selma native, Sewell is a leading voice on voting rights, economic justice, and healthcare equity. She serves on the House Ways and Means Committee and the Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence.

name: Nick Begich III
bio: Nick Begich III is the U.S. Representative for Alaska’s At-Large congressional district, elected in 2024. A businessman and technology entrepreneur, Begich focuses on energy, economic development, and federal accountability. He serves on the House Natural Resources and Small Business Committees.

endorsements: Alaska Republican Party, National Federation of Independent Business, Americans for Prosperity

name: Amata Coleman Radewagen
bio: Amata Coleman Radewagen is the U.S. Delegate for American Samoa’s At-Large congressional district, serving since 2015. She is the first woman to represent American Samoa in Congress and focuses on veterans’ affairs, healthcare, and territorial development. She serves on the House Veterans’ Affairs and Foreign Affairs Committees.

name: David Schweikert
bio: David Schweikert is the U.S. Representative for Arizona’s 1st congressional district, serving since 2011. A native of Arizona, Schweikert previously served in the state legislature and as Maricopa County Treasurer. He is known for his expertise in tax policy, budget reform, and technology-driven government efficiency. Schweikert serves on the House Ways and Means Committee and is a vocal advocate for free-market principles and fiscal restraint.
education: Arizona State University (BS in Finance, MBA)
endorsements: Club for Growth, National Taxpayers Union, Arizona Chamber of Commerce

platformFollowThrough.Healthcare: Backed market-based reforms to expand access and reduce costs without federal mandates.

name: Eli Crane
bio: Eli Crane is the U.S. Representative for Arizona’s 2nd congressional district, first elected in 2022. A former Navy SEAL and entrepreneur, Crane founded Bottle Breacher, a veteran-owned business featured on Shark Tank. He is known for his strong conservative positions on border security, veterans’ issues, and limited government. Crane serves on the House Homeland Security and Veterans’ Affairs Committees and is a member of the Freedom Caucus.

endorsements: House Freedom Fund, National Rifle Association, Arizona Police Association

platformFollowThrough.Limited Government: Voted for the REINS Act to limit executive overreach.
platformFollowThrough.Second Amendment: Opposed federal firearm restrictions and supported nationwide concealed carry reciprocity.

proposals: Secure the southern border, reduce federal overreach, expand support for veterans, and defend gun rights.

name: Yassamin Ansari
bio: Yassamin Ansari is the U.S. Representative for Arizona’s 3rd congressional district, elected in 2024. A climate policy expert and former Phoenix City Council member, Ansari previously worked for the United Nations and advised global leaders on climate action. She is the first Iranian-American woman elected to Congress and focuses on environmental justice, affordable housing, and youth engagement. Ansari serves on the House Energy and Commerce Committee and the Select Committee on the Climate Crisis.
education: Stanford University (BA in International Relations), University of Cambridge (MPhil in Development Studies)
endorsements: League of Conservation Voters, EMILY’s List, Sunrise Movement

platformFollowThrough.Affordable Housing: Secured federal grants for low-income housing development in Phoenix and surrounding areas.
platformFollowThrough.Youth Empowerment: Launched the Congressional Youth Climate Corps to engage young leaders in sustainability.
platformFollowThrough.Environmental Justice: Advocated for EPA reforms to prioritize pollution mitigation in underserved communities.

proposals: Fund climate resilience, expand affordable housing, engage youth in sustainability, and reform environmental policy.

govtrackStats.Committee Positions: Member of Energy and Commerce, and Climate Crisis Committees

name: Greg Stanton
bio: Greg Stanton is the U.S. Representative for Arizona’s 4th congressional district, serving since 2019. He previously served as Mayor of Phoenix from 2012 to 2018, where he focused on infrastructure, education, and economic development. In Congress, Stanton has prioritized water security, immigration reform, and bipartisan infrastructure investment. He serves on the House Judiciary and Transportation and Infrastructure Committees.

endorsements: End Citizens United, Sierra Club, Arizona Education Association

proposals: Modernize infrastructure, protect water resources, reform immigration, and invest in public education.

name: Andy Biggs
bio: Andy Biggs is the U.S. Representative for Arizona’s 5th congressional district, serving since 2017. A former president of the Arizona Senate, Biggs is known for his staunch conservative positions and leadership within the House Freedom Caucus. He advocates for limited government, border security, and constitutional originalism. Biggs serves on the House Judiciary and Oversight Committees and is a vocal critic of executive overreach.

name: Juan Ciscomani
bio: Juan Ciscomani is the U.S. Representative for Arizona’s 6th congressional district, first elected in 2022. Born in Hermosillo, Mexico and raised in Tucson, Ciscomani is the first Mexican-born member of Congress from Arizona. He previously served as a senior advisor to Governor Doug Ducey and worked in workforce development and international trade. Ciscomani focuses on border security, economic growth, and education reform, and serves on the House Appropriations and Veterans’ Affairs Committees.

name: Adelita Grijalva
bio: Adelita Grijalva is the U.S. Representative for Arizona’s 7th congressional district, elected in a 2025 special election following the passing of her father, longtime Congressman Raúl Grijalva. A Tucson native and former member of the Pima County Board of Supervisors and Tucson Unified School District Governing Board, she has focused her public service on education equity, environmental justice, and community health. Grijalva is a member of the Congressional Progressive Caucus and serves on the House Education and Natural Resources Committees.

name: Abraham Hamadeh
bio: Abraham Hamadeh is the U.S. Representative for Arizona’s 8th congressional district, elected in 2024. A former prosecutor and U.S. Army intelligence officer, Hamadeh previously ran for Arizona Attorney General in 2022. He is known for his strong conservative positions on law enforcement, election integrity, and national security. Hamadeh serves on the House Judiciary and Armed Services Committees and is a member of the Republican Study Committee.

name: Paul Gosar
bio: Paul Gosar is the U.S. Representative for Arizona’s 9th congressional district, serving since 2011. A former dentist and small business owner, Gosar is known for his strong conservative positions and membership in the House Freedom Caucus. He has focused on energy independence, federal land use reform, and government accountability. Gosar serves on the House Oversight and Natural Resources Committees and is a vocal critic of federal overreach.

He serves on the House Transportation and Agriculture Committees and is known for advocating infrastructure investment and disaster resilience in farming communities.

govtrackStats.Committee Positions: Chair of Ways and Means Subcommittee on Tax Policy

name: Tom McClintock
bio: Tom McClintock is the U.S. Representative for California’s 5th congressional district, serving since 2009. A veteran of California state politics, McClintock is known for his fiscal conservatism, constitutional originalism, and advocacy for limited government. He serves on the House Judiciary and Natural Resources Committees and frequently speaks on budget discipline and federalism.
education: University of California, Los Angeles (BA in Political Science)
endorsements: National Taxpayers Union, Club for Growth, American Conservative Union
platform: Fiscal discipline, constitutional rights, federalism, and land use reform.

platformFollowThrough.Fiscal Discipline: Opposed deficit spending and introduced legislation to cap federal expenditures.
platformFollowThrough.Constitutional Rights: Advocated for Second Amendment protections and opposed federal surveillance expansion.
platformFollowThrough.Federalism: Supported states’ rights legislation and opposed federal mandates on education and healthcare.
platformFollowThrough.Land Use Reform: Pushed for local control over forest management and opposed restrictive land designations.

proposals: Balance the budget, defend constitutional liberties, restore state sovereignty, and reform federal land policies.

govtrackStats.Committee Positions: Member of Judiciary and Natural Resources Committees
